page.title: 18 WESTON FAVELL VILLAGE AREA
page.content: Along Wellingborough Road are a fish and chip shop, butcher and "The Trumpet" public house. There are established bungalows and houses on Ridgeway, also some mock-Tudor thatched cottages. Down Church Way are some 19th Century houses and some newer houses. There is a tennis club. This residential area is well looked after. The High Street has old village cottages, but most of these have been modernised. Bridgewater Drive is a modern estate to the south of Weston Favell. It has a pub called "The Road to Morocco". There are green spaces, some allotments, a small playground and a stream. There is a middle school, some of the pupils coming from a lower school on Church Way. Landcross Drive estate has 'bus stops, a few shops and a post office. It is well kept.
